intro: Trinia lessingii, commonly known as the narrowleaf trinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Trinia lessingii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
